item.description:
And now for something completely different!

Andalusian music is the musical and poetic traditions from Medieval Andalusia that have been preserved and developed in North Africa. Three generations of artists bring Andalusian traditions alive with the Orchestra of Tangier, led by the legendary master Ahmed Zaitouni, Said Belcadi, the most promising emerging vocalist of Morocco, and Lotfi Bouchnak, the leading Andalusian musician of Tunisia.

MENA Music (which produces this performance) was established in 2006 in New York City by Kazko Kawai in an effort to enhance mutual understanding between the USA and the Arab world through music in the post 9/11 world. The organization is committed to bringing the best musicians from the Middle East (ME) and North Africa (NA) to North America to develop audiences for music from these regions.

NEW!! I am trying out Paypal. If you want to sit with the group (and be part of a block of tickets that I will buy together), please send me $30 for your ticket via this site BY SATURDAY FEB 7TH at 10 pm as I want to book in time. This is a discount price which includes $1 for me to help me recoup my organizer costs. Please email me as soon as you send payment - this is the first time I've tried this.

For those who'd like to meet to eat first, which is a nice way to start the evening, let's try Pho & I at 6 pm - Vietnamese and Thai food at 267 Huntington Ave, Boston - let me know if you plan to come to dinner by Feb 18th at the latest.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet before at Pho & I restaurant at 6 pm or at Jordan Hall at 7. 45 pm
item.name: Andalusian Music Festival with the Orchestra of Tangier
